title: Brook's Story Hints at Joyboy's Whale Connection
author: Game Rant / One Piece Theorists
theory: Brook's relationship with Laboon mirrors a potential connection between Joyboy and an ancient whale. The theory suggests that similar to Laboon waiting for Brook, there was a member of Joyboy's crew who was a massive whale far greater in size (similar to Zunesha). Evidence includes the massive tree carved into a whale at the center of Zou's city square, underneath which a Road Poneglyph is located. The theory proposes the One Piece treasure might be connected to recognition by such a whale - just as Brook cares for his afro so Laboon would recognize him even as a skeleton, this could have been Joyboy's thinking. The whale under Long Ring Long Land would recognize the person who claimed it as the reincarnation of Joyboy, the same as how Laboon would only recognize Brook because of his distinctive hairstyle.
evidence: The whale carving in Zou's city square where a Road Poneglyph is hidden
Laboon's 50-year wait paralleling potential ancient promises
Brook maintaining his afro for recognition despite being a skeleton
The whale under Long Ring Long Land as a potential parallel to Laboon
Zunesha's similar nature as an ancient, massive creature with connections to the past

title: Brook Will Outlive the Straw Hats, Repeating His Tragedy
author: CBR / One Piece Community
theory: Brook's Devil Fruit (Yomi Yomi no Mi) grants him biological immortality after his one resurrection. This means after the Straw Hats accomplish their dreams and the series ends, Brook will face the same tragedy again - watching his beloved crewmates die one by one, just as he did with the Rumbar Pirates. He will be left alone once more, potentially for centuries, making his fate the most tragic of all Straw Hats. Episode 379's revelation of Brook surviving alone on a ruined ship for 50 years foreshadows this potential future.
evidence: The Yomi Yomi no Mi grants biological immortality after resurrection
Brook already experienced this tragedy once with the Rumbar Pirates
Brook lived alone for 50 years before meeting the Straw Hats
The parallel between his two crews makes the repetition thematically fitting
Brook's character arc involves accepting friendship despite knowing the pain of loss
